# Session A

### Slide 20

$Y_{obs}$ should be 1 in $P(R|Y_{obs}, \psi)$: it only depends on a constant, like 2/7 in the example. So, $P(R|1,\psi=\frac{2}{7})$.

### Slide 23

The $\theta$'s are the variables of scientific interest. The missing data model is generally not. If the two models are independent, we say that the missingness is ignoable.
